TopicTitle: Do you have a screenshot that makes you laugh every time?

Articles.Content:
![screenshot0_zpsrjbnore4.png](http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v220/stargate525/screenshot0_zpsrjbnore4.png)

Well at least my debris is naturally tidy...
![M27HJ0r.png](http://i.imgur.com/M27HJ0r.png)
Last thing i flown in 0.90 ![O3OLGk1.png](http://i.imgur.com/O3OLGk1.png)

Poor Archibald, just hasn't been the same since that tumble from the ladder on decent to Eve. Poor guy has to walk around like that for the rest of his ten year stay on the planet LOL!

![03Y3vnF.png](http://i.imgur.com/03Y3vnF.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-27T16:28:15Z" title="07/27/2015 04:28  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 27, 2015</time> by Jolly\_Roger**

> 
> Last thing i flown in 0.90 [http://i.imgur.com/O3OLGk1.png](http://i.imgur.com/O3OLGk1.png)

Now that's what I call sending the old version off with a bang!

![BS66Spz.png](http://i.imgur.com/BS66Spz.png)

I don't know why he's so sad about returning home.

So many times the kerbal's facial expressions make everything worth while ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

And sometimes ksp physics also plays a part

![Kerbal_SISW_Wobble.gif](http://www.i2net.me.uk/files/Games/KerbalSP/Ships/Stock-SISW/Kerbal_SISW_Wobble.gif)

From: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/22251-Showcase-SPACE-STATIONS!-Post-your-pictures-here?p=531483&viewfull=1#post531483](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/22251-Showcase-SPACE-STATIONS!-Post-your-pictures-here?p=531483&viewfull=1#post531483)

Wow! There's a slight anomaly in that space station. I'm sure this GIF was captured right before the sudden uncontrolled dis-assembly event.

Although... those oscillations are somehow, hypnotic. ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)

JR

> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/BS66Spz.png](http://i.imgur.com/BS66Spz.png)
> I don't know why he's so sad about returning home.

He wanted to be in spaaaace!

This guy couldn't get enough high-speed boating! He loved it.

![COdrqJt.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/COdrqJt.jpg)

At last! I've been waiting for a place to put this image and I believe it's time to show it! +Rep if you like it! I'll return the favour!

![Vr66fgU.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/Vr66fgU.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-22T15:10:46Z" title="07/22/2015 03:10  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 22, 2015</time> by ryan234abc**

> 
> And sometimes ksp physics also plays a part
> From: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/22251-Showcase-SPACE-STATIONS!-Post-your-pictures-here?p=531483&viewfull=1#post531483](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/22251-Showcase-SPACE-STATIONS!-Post-your-pictures-here?p=531483&viewfull=1#post531483)

Spooky.
[http://i.imgur.com/UAqJtZL.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/UAqJtZL.jpg) this one often ; )

From back in .20, still gets me.

![3GlqeOT.png](http://i.imgur.com/3GlqeOT.png)

Latest rover prototype, an experiment in using the RoveMax model 3 wheels. After an all-wheel version just got all flat tires, I started incorporating landing gear. This attempt, uh, didn't work. I call it the Squatting Dog, for reasons that should be obvious...

![wtzm57i.jpg?1](http://i.imgur.com/wtzm57i.jpg?1)

Jeb, of course, was the first Kerbal to land on the Mun in my current career game. He was so excited to get out of the lander and step onto the surface of the Mun, that he fell on his back instead:

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/dbuE1)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-24T20:43:37Z" title="07/24/2015 08:43  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 24, 2015</time> by Rthsom**

![R9gFvTo.png](http://i.imgur.com/R9gFvTo.png)

Lithobraking science

After a pretty hairy landing on a mountaintop, Val does her best to balance the plane for a takeoff position.

![oiHQA1a.png](http://i.imgur.com/oiHQA1a.png)

![d26df20acf.jpg](http://puu.sh/gzU4h/d26df20acf.jpg)

Successful landing !
![xMHW5V7.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/xMHW5V7.jpg)

> 
> After a pretty hairy landing on a mountaintop, Val does her best to balance the plane for a takeoff position.

Bwahaha! That is kerbal problem solving at it's finest.

When Jebediah is scared, you know you done messed up. 

![KbkEntRh.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/KbkEntRh.jpg)

![wMtAOqth.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/wMtAOqth.jpg)

It's a space program game. Why not build 1930s heavy bombers? You know, to serve as propaganda for hard-working combined workers soviets triumphing against the arrogant bourgeois? 

![mnIlJiW.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/mnIlJiW.jpg)

Well, I kinda had to use "Infinite Fuel", "Unbreakable Joints", "No Crash Damage", and "Ignore Max Temperature" to do this, but it makes for a cool screenshot.

![ISeUnNy.png](http://i.imgur.com/ISeUnNy.png)

And yes, I made the landing.

![1LZ6KVt.png](http://i.imgur.com/1LZ6KVt.png)

100% historically accurate

![LAfiCFl.png](http://i.imgur.com/LAfiCFl.png)

> 
> It's a space program game. Why not build 1930s heavy bombers? You know, to serve as propaganda for hard-working combined workers soviets triumphing against the arrogant bourgeois? 
> [http://i.imgur.com/mnIlJiW.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/mnIlJiW.jpg)

The only thing that made me laugh here is how you used modded parts for the engines and Tweakscale but you refused to use a modded part for the cockpit and instead used an ugly mashup of structural panels.
